definition: to open/to start/to initiate/to enlighten or awaken/to state/to inform
Qi son of Yu the Great 禹[Yu3], reported founder of the Xia Dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 Chao2] (c. 2070-c. 1600 BC)

sentences.english: Enlightenment, it seems, always comes from an earnest study of the Word of God.
sentences.chinese: 启迪似乎总是从恳切地研究上帝的道而来。

sentences.english: The rule has achieved satisfactory curative effects in clinics and is an enlightenment to the treating method of anky…
sentences.chinese: 该治法对临床攻治强直性脊柱炎有一定的启迪。

sentences.english: Daniel Wong gave a smile – a sophisticate smilethat inspired the reporters.
sentences.chinese: 黄博士脸上露出的一丝深沉的微笑启迪了在场记者。

sentences.english: It has great significance of edification for the development and construction of boundary and drop-behind districts.
sentences.chinese: 对边穷后进地区的开发与建设很有启迪借鉴意义。

sentences.english: Part I lays out the most essential information in the journey to graphical enlightenment.
sentences.chinese: 第1部分为图形的启迪之旅铺排了最基本的信息。

sentences.english: Each chapter begins with an epigraph, a quote to enlighten and amuse.
sentences.chinese: 各章开头引用了一句名言，以启迪思考，娱悦身心。

sentences.english: It gives us much for thought for today's anti-corruption work.
sentences.chinese: 对今天的反腐倡廉工作有所启迪。

sentences.english: It was the first movie to inspire me.
sentences.chinese: 它也是第一部启迪我的电影。

sentences.english: The first chapter is "western art's enlightenment on Guo Moruo's early poetry".
sentences.chinese: 第一章“郭沫若早期诗学受西方文艺的启迪”。

sentences.english: I’m always inspired by the rebirth of the seasons.
sentences.chinese: 四季轮回总是带给我启迪。

sentences.english: The t'ao (way)enlightens our minds and perfects our cultivation and practice.
sentences.chinese: 道，可以启迪性灵，完全人格修养。

sentences.english: A positive redefinition of Rebecca provides us with great enlightenment.
sentences.chinese: 从正面的角度解读贝姬会给我们很多人生启迪。

sentences.english: On this World Malaria Day, let us take inspiration from our successes.
sentences.chinese: 在今天的世界疟疾日，让我们从成就中获得启迪。

sentences.english: Temporary exhibition will remain everybody the everlasting aftertaste and permanent edification.
sentences.chinese: 短暂的展示将给人们留下永久的回味，永恒的启迪。

sentences.english: The original is meditation really dialogue, is the inspiration of life.
sentences.chinese: 原来是静思本真的对话，是启迪的生命感悟。

sentences.english: A pioneer in blood Lichen, Beacon Road, Blue jacket, a look back at history, inspire new thinking.
sentences.chinese: 先驱者一片血忱，毕路蓝褛，回望历史，启迪新思。

definition: to enlighten/to explain (a text etc)/to stimulate (a mental attitude)/enlightenment/revelation/motivation
variant of 啟蒙|启蒙[qi3 meng2]/to instruct the young
to instruct the young/to initiate/to awake sb from ignorance/to free sb from prejudice or superstition/primer/enlightened/the Enlightenment/Western learning from the late Qing dynasty
inspiration/insight/a burst of creativity in scientific or artistic endeavor
to move and appeal/to rally to a cause/to impel/to inspire
